titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Sixth Ward, First Election District poll list 1977.100
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T15:56-0500

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Sixth Ward, First Election District poll list

physdesc.extent: in one folder in one oversize box.

did.abstract: Poll list compiled in 1871 by the Clerks of Election of the First Election District of the Sixth Ward of Brooklyn from the results of an 1870 election. The list includes the names and addresses of 1,328 voters, as well as marks indicating which issues each person voted upon.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Clerks of Election in the First Election District of the Sixth Ward (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ludovic Bennet, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Sixth Ward, First Election District poll list, 1977.100, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
